description: Query the version information of a server.

check.code:
target=`cat /etc/os-release | grep PRETTY_NAME | sed 's/PRETTY_NAME=//g' | tr -d '"'`
[ "$target"x != "$1"x ] && exit 1
exit 0

description: Query the number of logical CPU cores.
Query the model name of the first CPU (logical core 0).

check.code:
target=`cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep -m1 -E '^processor|^model name' | grep 'model name' | awk -F ': ' '{print $2}'`
[ "$target"x != "$1"x ] && exit 1
exit 0

example.code: cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep -m1 -E '^processor|^model name' | grep 'model name' | awk -F ': ' '{print $2}'

description: Query the total memory size and used memory size, output with two spaces apart
Inquire how many processes are currently running.
Query the clock frequency of the CPU.

example.code: cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep -m1 -E 'cpu MHz' | grep 'cpu MHz' | awk -F ': ' '{print $2}'

description: Query the number of physical CPUs.

check.code:
target=`cat /proc/cpuinfo| grep "physical id"| sort| uniq| wc -l'`
[ "$target"x != "$1"x ] && exit 1
exit 0

example.code: cat /proc/cpuinfo| grep "physical id"| sort| uniq| wc -l

description: Query the name of the disk with the maximum available space. Hint: the Size column indicates the disk space.

check.code:
target=`df -hT | grep -E '.*[0-9]+.*' | sort -k3 -rh | head -n 1 | awk '{print $1}''`
[ "$target"x != "$1"x ] && exit 1
exit 0
